icarus.reactor

Class Component

  • java.lang.Object
    • icarus.reactor.Component
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CondenserPump, MajorComponent, Turbine, WaterPump

    public abstract class Component
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Component abstract class, used for all components that can fail.
    Author:
    Team Haddock
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Component(double failProb, int fix)
      Primary constructor for use when initialising a new game
      Component(double failProb, int fix, boolean functioning, boolean repairal, int fixingProgress)
      Constructor used when loading a Component from a saved state.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Component

        public Component(double failProb,
         int fix)
        Primary constructor for use when initialising a new game
        Parameters:
        failProb - The (maximum) probability of a component failing
        fix - The number of timesteps required to fix a component

      • Component

        public Component(double failProb,
         int fix,
         boolean functioning,
         boolean repairal,
         int fixingProgress)
        Constructor used when loading a Component from a saved state.
        Parameters:
        failProb - The (maximum) probability of a component failing
        fix - The number of timesteps required to fix a component
        functioning - Whether or not the Component is currently functioning
        repairal - Whether or not the Component is currently being repaired
        fixingProgress - The progress on a current fix

    • Method Detail

      • checkFail

        public abstract boolean checkFail()
        This method calculates whether a Component has failed this timestep.
        Returns:
        Returns whether the Component has failed or not (ie !functional)

      • fixCycle

        public boolean fixCycle()
        This method progresses a repair on a component that is currently undergoing repair.
        Returns:
        True on completion of repair.

      • getFunctional

        public boolean getFunctional()
        Returns:
        Whether or not Component is functional

      • getRepairing

        public boolean getRepairing()
        Returns:
        Whether or not Component is repairing

      • beginFix

        public boolean beginFix()
                 throws NoFixNeededException
        Begins a fix on a failed component
        Returns:
        True if fix has begun successfully
        Throws:
        NoFixNeededException

      • getFixRemaining

        public int getFixRemaining()
        Calculates and returns remaining time on a repair
        Returns:
        The number of timesteps until the repair is completed.
